conclusion: Determine the charge passing through R1 when switch S is opened.
When switch S is closed, both capacitors C1 and C2 are charged by the voltage source E.
Total equivalent resistance is R1 + R2 since they are in series.
Current I through each resistor is I = E / (R1 + R2).
Given values: R1 = 4.0 Ω, R2 = 6.0 Ω, E = 10 V.
Total resistance R_total = R1 + R2 = 10 Ω.
Charge Q on a capacitor is Q = CV.
Voltage V across each capacitor is equal to emf E.
Charge on C1: Q1 = 30 μF * 10 V = 300 μC.
Charge on C2: Q2 = 30 μF * 10 V = 300 μC.
When switch S is opened, capacitors act as voltage sources.
Voltage across each capacitor remains 10 V after switch is opened.
Charge passing through R1 is same as during charging phase.
Charge passing through R1 after switch is opened is 300 μC.
